content.raw: we could/should put a README or something in that directory so people understand why the information is duplicated. Could we have CMake install a symlink from manifest.xml to database.config ?
content.html: we could/should put a README or something in that directory so people understand why the information is duplicated. Could we have CMake install a symlink from manifest.xml to database.config ?

content.raw: We could just rename it if we don't want to support versions of gazebo prior to 1.4.
content.html: We could just rename it if we don't want to support versions of gazebo prior to 1.4.

content.raw: looks like it is installing (gazebo) manifest.xml as well as model.config for the models, in ros/sandia_hand_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt   ?
content.html: looks like it is installing (gazebo) manifest.xml as well as model.config for the models, in ros/sandia_hand_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt ?

content.raw: yeah, I see your point now, that makes sense. I guess it comes down to, do we want to support gazebo < 1.4 with this package?  If we are co-releasing it with a drcsim version that is < 1.4, then we have to... but if not, if its public debut will be with gazebo 1.4, I guess we might as well just only support gazebo >= 1.4 for clarity's sake. but I can be persuaded.
content.html: yeah, I see your point now, that makes sense. I guess it comes down to, do we want to support gazebo < 1.4 with this package? If we are co-releasing it with a drcsim version that is < 1.4, then we have to... but if not, if its public debut will be with gazebo 1.4, I guess we might as well just only support gazebo >= 1.4 for clarity's sake. but I can be persuaded.

content.raw:
this is being persnickety, but we don't need the RENAME clause for installing model.config on line 25 of ros/sandia_hand_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt since we aren't renaming it, just installing it.

of a more substantive nature, do we need to also include a copy of database.config, installed (as a duplicate) manifest.xml, for the same reason we need model.config and manifest.xml files?
content.html:
this is being persnickety, but we don't need the RENAME clause for installing model.config on line 25 of ros/sandia_hand_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt since we aren't renaming it, just installing it.

of a more substantive nature, do we need to also include a copy of database.config, installed (as a duplicate) manifest.xml, for the same reason we need model.config and manifest.xml files?

content.raw:
I think we do need the rename clause since it's made a temporary combined name `${model_basename}.model.config` with a `.` to separate the model basename from the extension, and then installing to a file named model.config at a path including the model basename. It's basically what was there before but I renamed to model.config and the diff highlighting is weird.

We don't need a duplicate of the database.config files because those files are not currently used by anything on a local machine. They are used when gazebo fetches models from the model database server. That begs the question why we even have the database.config file. It won't break any current versions of gazebo to remove it.
content.html:
I think we do need the rename clause since it's made a temporary combined name ${model_basename}.model.config with a . to separate the model basename from the extension, and then installing to a file named model.config at a path including the model basename. It's basically what was there before but I renamed to model.config and the diff highlighting is weird.

We don't need a duplicate of the database.config files because those files are not currently used by anything on a local machine. They are used when gazebo fetches models from the model database server. That begs the question why we even have the database.config file. It won't break any current versions of gazebo to remove it.

content.raw: thanks for explaining. looks good to me.
content.html: thanks for explaining. looks good to me.

content.raw:
Database.config is only needed for model database that resides on remote servers.  If installed locally, gazebo ignores it.

On the other hand, the reason we renamed manifest.xml to model.config is so they can co-exist, so we don't have to duplicate the same model information for both ROS and Gazebo.  Should we install both?
content.html:
Database.config is only needed for model database that resides on remote servers. If installed locally, gazebo ignores it.

On the other hand, the reason we renamed manifest.xml to model.config is so they can co-exist, so we don't have to duplicate the same model information for both ROS and Gazebo. Should we install both?
